p: Compound 9 was prepared by dissolving compound 8 (1 mmol) in methanol (50 ml) followed by addition of 10% Pd/C (0.1 mmol) and the reaction was stirred overnight under a hydrogen atmosphere. The mixture was filtered through Celite and the filtrate was evaporated to dryness to obtain 9 that was used without further purification. Brownish white solid, yield 99.0%, MP: >250 °C. 1H NMR (500 MHz, DMSO-d 6): δ 8.66 (s, 1H), 8.13 (dd, 1H, J = 2.8, 0.7 Hz), 7.86 (s, 1H), 7.83–7.76 (m, 2H), 7.56 (dd, 1H, J = 9.1, 2.8 Hz), 7.45–7.39 (m, 2H), 6.49 (d, 1H, J = 9.1 Hz), 4.62 (s, 2H), 3.64 (t, 4H, J = 5.7 Hz), 3.21–3.19 (m, 4H); 13C NMR (125 MHz, DMSO-d 6): δ 158.11, 156.84, 154.66, 152.01, 144.33, 138.26, 130.33, 128.81, 127.50, 123.38, 123.24, 106.91, 66.48, 46.47, 40.64, 40.55, 40.47, 40.38, 40.30, 40.21, 40.13, 40.04, 39.97, 39.88, 39.71, 39.54. HRMS (ES +): m/z calculated for C 20H 19F 3N 6O 2: 433.1594 [M + H] +. Found 433.1595.
